greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: strictly decreasing sequences of positive numbers given in lexicographic order.
comment: Length of n-th row given by A000120(n);
Min of n-th row given by A001511(n);
Sum of n-th row given by A029931(n);
Product of n-th row given by A096111(n);
Max of n-th row given by A113473(n);
Numerator of sum of reciprocals of n-th row given by A116416(n);
Denominator of sum of reciprocals of n-th row given by A116417(n);
LCM of n-th row given by A271410(n).
The first appearance of n is at A001787(n - 1).
n-th row begins at index A000788(n - 1) for n > 0.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: Row n is given by the exponents in the binary expansion of 2*n. For example, row 5 = [3, 1] because 2*5 = 2^3 + 2^1.
xref: Cf. A048793 gives the rows in reverse order.
results.author: _Peter Kagey_, Apr 17 2016
